newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian local public transport hit by strikes.
newsitem.headline: Italian local public transport hit by strikes.

text.p: Public transport workers went on strike in many Italian cities on Friday in the latest stoppage in a long-running contract dispute with the government.
The 24-hour national strike halted most bus, tram and commuter rail services in Rome, forcing people who normally travel to work by public transport to use taxis or private cars.
Milan and other cities were also hit by stoppages.
Local transport unions also planned a demonstration in Rome on Friday to protest against their exclusion from contract negotiations last April between national unions and the government.
They say working practices outlined in the new contracts will lead to reduced incomes. The one-day stoppage was the latest in a wave of transport strikes in Italy this year.

Last month, Rome came to a virtual standstill when local transport unions staged a 24-hour wildcat strike. Air traffic controllers, railway and port workers have also been involved in industrial action.
